    • Method Detail

      • createPartialGraphForTesting

        public com.facebook.buck.command.ProjectTest.ProjectWithModules createPartialGraphForTesting(@Nullable
                                                                                    JavaPackageFinder javaPackageFinder)
                                                                                      throws IOException
        Creates a PartialGraph with two android_binary rules, each of which depends on the same android_library. The difference between the two is that one lists Guava in its no_dx list and the other does not.

        The PartialGraph also includes three project_config rules: one for the android_library, and one for each of the android_binary rules.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • testThatJarsAreListedBeforeModules

        public void testThatJarsAreListedBeforeModules()
                                        throws IOException
        In the context of Robolectric, httpcore-4.0.1.jar needs to be loaded before the android.jar associated with the Android SDK. Both httpcore-4.0.1.jar and android.jar define org.apache.http.params.BasicHttpParams; however, only httpcore-4.0.1.jar contains a real implementation of BasicHttpParams whereas android.jar contains a stub implementation of BasicHttpParams.

        One way to fix this problem would be to "tag" httpcore-4.0.1.jar to indicate that it must appear before the Android SDK (or anything that transitively depends on the Android SDK) when listing dependencies for IntelliJ. This would be a giant kludge to the prebuilt_jar rule, so instead we just list jars before modules within an <orderEntry scope="TEST"/> or an <orderEntry scope="COMPILE"/> group.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • testCreatePathToProjectDotPropertiesFileForModule

        public void testCreatePathToProjectDotPropertiesFileForModule()

      • testSrcRoots

        public void testSrcRoots()
                  throws IOException
        A project_config()'s src_roots argument can be None, [], or a non-empty array. Each of these should be treated differently.
        Throws:
        IOException
